title: Brisbane
summary: Brisbane (/ˈbrɪzbən/ (listen) BRIZ-bən[9]), sited on the Meanjin ( /miˈændʒɪn/) land of the Turrbal Country,[10] is the capital and most populous city of the Australian state of Queensland,[11] and the third-most populous city in Australia. Brisbane's metropolitan area has a population of around 2.6 million,[12] and it lies at the centre of the South East Queensland metropolitan region, which encompasses a population of around 3.8 million.[13] The Brisbane central business district is situated within a peninsula of the Brisbane River about 15 km (9 mi) from its mouth at Moreton Bay, a bay of the Coral Sea.[14] The metropolitan area extends in all directions along the hilly floodplain of the Brisbane River Valley between Moreton Bay and the Taylor and D'Aguilar mountain ranges. It sprawls across several of Australia's most populous local government areas (LGAs) — most centrally the City of Brisbane, the most populous LGA in the nation.
